definition: A large company that provides financial protection and risk management services to individuals and businesses, typically offering various types of insurance policies and related products. It is commonly used to refer to a major player in the insurance industry, often operating on a national or international scale.

examples.german: Der Versicherungskonzern hat seinen Hauptsitz in München.
examples.english: The insurance conglomerate is headquartered in Munich.

examples.german: Unser Unternehmen ist ein großer Versicherungskonzern.
examples.english: Our company is a major insurance conglomerate.

examples.german: Der Versicherungskonzern bietet verschiedene Versicherungsprodukte an.
examples.english: The insurance conglomerate offers various insurance products.

examples.german: Der Versicherungskonzern hat viele Tochtergesellschaften weltweit.
examples.english: The insurance conglomerate has many subsidiaries worldwide.

examples.german: Der Versicherungskonzern ist an der Börse gelistet.
examples.english: The insurance conglomerate is listed on the stock exchange.
